description: Details pursuant to the discharge of Conditions 4 (Energy Statement), 6 (Landscape Scheme), 9 (Refuse and Recycling Management Plan) and 16 (Parking Design and Management Plan) as attached to Appeal ref. APP/R5510/W/23/3327482 dated 15/05/2024 (Planning Application ref. 43794/APP/2021/3685 dated 21/03/2023) (Erection of a hotel and associated access, parking, landscaping and refuse storage).
application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: Insufficient information has been submitted to satisfy the requirements of Condition 4 (Energy Statement) as attached to Appeal ref. APP/R5510/W/23/3327482 dated 15/05/2024 (Planning Application ref. 43794/APP/2021/3685 dated 21/03/2023). The information submitted fails to ensure sufficient energy savings are secured on-site, contrary to Policy DMEI 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 2 (2020) and Policy SI2 of the London Plan (2021). The application is therefore refused.

Insufficient information has been submitted to satisfy the requirements of Condition 6 (Landscape Scheme) as attached to Appeal ref. APP/R5510/W/23/3327482 dated 15/05/2024 (Planning Application ref. 43794/APP/2021/3685 dated 21/03/2023). The information submitted fails to preserve and enhance visual amenity, contrary to Policies DMHB 11 and DMHB 14 of the of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 2 (2020) and Policies G1 and G5 of the London Plan (2021). The application is therefore refused.

Insufficient information has been submitted to satisfy the requirements of Condition 16 (Parking Design and Management Plan) as attached to Appeal ref. APP/R5510/W/23/3327482 dated 15/05/2024 (Planning Application ref. 43794/APP/2021/3685 dated 21/03/2023). The information submitted fails to comply with Policy DMT 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 2 (2020) and Policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan (2021). The application is therefore refused.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies from the  Local Plan Part 1, Local Plan Part 2, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition further guidance was offered to the applicant by the case officer during the processing of the application to identify the amendments to address those elements of the scheme considered unacceptable which the applicant did not respond to.
